title: (17455) Caldes de Malavella - Carrer Solei
description: Not possible with a trailer! Very quiet area with 5 places 300m from the center, with water and electricity (electricity works according to the street lighting program). We were there and at 9am when the lights were off we had electricity. That alone, there are 4 connectors for the 5-seater, so if you're last you'll have to connect using another motorhome. For the last place you will need a 50 meter extension to reach the socket area. Be careful, the only problem is that your motorhome will be drowned in the droppings of pigeons and birds. At 100 meters you have a thermal hot spring. The inhabitants come to fill their bottles there to drink it without problem.

title: (17240) Llagostera -

A magnificent view of the sea and its sunrise and on the other side a view of the mountains and its sunset. Very accessible places we went there with our heavy weight (be careful it climbs). The place can accommodate a heavy pea or two vans.

title: (17246) Sant Feliu de Guíxols -
description: Beautiful and quiet parking, without mobile home prohibition signs, in a sparse cork oak forest. Only 5km away from the Costa Brava and still far away from all the hustle and bustle of the coast. There are several pitches on partly level and partly slightly sloping ground. (Caution some thick roots). Easy access from Sant Feliu via asphalt road. The highlight is the rocking stone of Pedralta and the great view. Suitable for a picnic in the shade of the trees as well as for an undisturbed overnight stay.

title: (17240) Santa Cristina de Aro - GIV-6612

We had no problems, but I imagine that during the school season, there will be more noise in the morning. it has no source of water. The only one nearby is on the other side of the road, in front of the tourist office, but when we went there, it was cordoned off.

title: (17320) Tossa de Mar - 1 Carrer Miramar
description: Ample parking. like many car parks in Spain if you arrive before the doorman and leave after him you will not pay anything. Shade in the motorhome area clinging to the mountain in the morning, dirt parking, sun next to the car area... Ignoring the misplaced GPS location forces you to make a detour. Follow the P1 parking instructions from Google Maps itself. You have to pass between the Skate Park and the Bus Parking to access the 1-lane road. View photos from Google Maps

title: (17320) Tossa de Mar - 6 Avinguda Costa Brava

title: (17249) Castell-Platja d'Aro - Unnamed Road
description: Steep track, not suitable for large caravans, you remove a fence and you can enter. Very quiet night.

title: (17457) Can Jordi - AP-7
description: Ideal place to take a break in the middle of the trip. It is not recommended for sleeping, but it has picnic tables, shade and it is pleasant. There is plenty of parking as it is quite busy.

title: (17242) Quart - Avda. de la Bòbila s/n
title_short: (17242) Quart - Avda. de la Bòbila s/n
description:
Free area for RVs no limit nger than 6.5 meters including water, grey water/potty emptying facilities  
much glass before the cleaning Place!!!
 5 spots for overnight parking (all free of charge). There are also recycling bins right next to the parking, plus a small neighbourhood "supermarket" a few blocks away. There's also a biking route nearby the leads to Girona in one direction (6 km) and Sant Feliu de Guíxols in the other (a tad further...35 km).

Very quiet at night, but a different story in the morning, as it's adjacent to a nursery school (you can guess the rest). Also worth noting: If you're coming from Girona and your navigator suggests the first exit to Quart, take into account that it involves going under a bridge with a 3m height limit, but there's another exit a few hundred metres further.

Please DO remember that this space is shared with local residents--it's actually the parking for the nursery school, so please be discreet and civil. Having spoken to the mayor (who I ran into by mere chance, and is very friendly and understanding), I can confirm that they don't mind us using some of the other spots not reserved for motorhomes, but 1) Only use the spots in the first row, next to the free facilities and 2) PLEASE do not park sideways: it's OK if you stick out a bit, but 3 RVs taking up 15 parking spots in NOT OK. It's rare to find FREE spots like this, so please be respectful, if not out of gratitude, for continuity's sake, or in the long run they'll end up being removed. Whether we choose to see it this way or not, we *are* indeed a community, our actions will surely affect those who come after us.

title: (17410) Sils - 23A Carretera Sta Coloma-palamos
description: Restaurant Parking without facilities - near a Consum supermarket and a gas station. Near the airport. We only stayed and are soon back, but very quiet night without surprises

name: CÀMPING CANYELLES
title: (17310) CÀMPING CANYELLES
description: Camping Canyelles. Camping located on the hill of Canyelles. Pleasant ground with a beautiful view of the sea. Pool, supermarket, bar, very clean bathrooms even if a bit old. No road or city noise, the calm of the morning is really nice. A small train commutes between the high plots of the campsite and the beach, but a 5-minute walk is enough to get there. Beach very nice while the Costa Brava is armored in late July. Two nights with 2 children in tent plus electricity 99 euros. I recommend without hesitation

title: (17412) Maçanet de la Selva - 12 Avinguda Torderola
title_short: (17412) Maçanet de la Selva - 12 Avinguda Torderola
description: For all types of domestic vehicles up to 12 meters long (8 places) and also 8 other places for short or normal length vehicles up to approx. 8 meters. Self-service laundry, supermarket and gas station with LPG next door. In a very welcoming city. Ideal for AP7 travelers to rest for a few days during a long trip. A charming town with lots of history. The rules of your stay are written on a large sign at the entrance: No camping behavior (no chairs/tables/awning), stay 72 hours maximum, keep your pitches and be considerate. But free stay plus electricity 16A, as much as you need, water payable. All newly done, with small trees and benches. A safe place, quiet at night and well lit.

title_short: (17412) Maçanet de la Selva - 48 Avinguda Sant Jordi

title_short: (17310) Lloret de Mar - 32 Carrer de l'Aiguaviva

title_short: (17421) Riudarenes - 41 Carrer Cami de la Riera

title: (17310) Lloret de Mar - 24 Camí Antic de Tossa

title: (17250) Platja d'Aro - 46 Carrer Rec del Molí
title_short: (17250) Platja d'Aro - 46 Carrer Rec del Molí
description: Fantastic place with pine trees that give a lot of shade. Very calm!

name: Camping LLoret Blau
title: (17310) Camping LLoret Blau
description: We spent 4 nights online reservation paid 30%, if you go directly you may not find a free place, very crowded, quite expensive this campsite 250eur, 2 adults 2 children caravan 6.4m, electricity included at the price above, 11eur electricity per day  .  The reason we stayed for several days was personally to meet up with family staying in a hotel near this campsite and to spend some time together and for a safe area for the campervan.  I spent most of the time in the city, so I did not benefit from the swimming pool or children's playground, etc., the location is near the beach, almost 10 minutes on foot, the price of food in the center for 4 people is about 60 euros  at a restaurant .  In the campsite you have a small market, you can find fresh bread and fresh croissants in the morning and some food, there is also a small restaurant but I didn't eat.  Showers and toilet area look old but acceptable in terms of cleanliness , when it is full in the week and with young people it is a mess in the toilet area, a lot of dust when a car is moving and a lot of ants, you must have powder for the little insects   , are  everywhere.  The gray water is poured at the entrance next to reception, the chemical toilet is located next to the toilets.  I don't regret staying, not other option in my case  but it is a very expensive campsite for the quality it looks like.

title: (17310) Lloret de Mar - 58 GI-682
description: Laundry with possibility of changing money (payment only by cash). Laundry and also

title: (17250) Platja d'Aro - 11 Carrer Juli Garreta
description: Close to everything. Suitable for long motorhomes as well. Before noon (weekend) there is a lot of space to park. Section under trees have big parking spots.  Drinking water available. Coordinates: 41°48'56.0"N 3°03'46.6"E Also near to laundry, cafe with free WiFi, playground and Pp's Park (the best for kids). About 10 min walk to the beach. A lot of shops, restaurants...

Almost flat.
